data.title: Small, geared toward kids age 2-7
data.text: Went with my 2 yr old and 5 yr old while visiting family. It's a nice place for the kids to play and explore for 45-60 minutes but is fairly small. Nice thing is it is in the same building as an art museum and up stairs they have a boot museum which is cool.

data.title: Beautiful historical museum!
data.text: This is an absolute "must see" when visiting Abilene, Texas. Even if you don't have children, the museum offers a wide variety of exhibits that will interest everyone and the overall beauty of the restored building is incredible

data.title: Children's Room
data.text: The title "children's museum" is misleading. There is a large room over an art exhibit and under a history exhibit, that is for children. It's clean, with interesting and fun hand's on activities, and a very well constructed "theatre" to play in. If I had a crawling or toddling child, I would have loved the "under 4" area. My 7 year old was mostly unimpressed, but he liked the magnetic mazes at the front and the giant wooden instrument at the back. My 3 and 5 year olds had a great time. They especially loved the life sized Operation Game and the full sized play ambulance. The climbing tree was a nice touch. That said, they were pretty much done in about 2 hours, so don't plan an entire day around it. We added the WW2 museum after a full lunch and it made for a nice outing.

data.title: The kids will love you
data.text: My kids could spend an entire day here playing & pretending!! There is a camera that they can pretend they are on the news. There are so many learning areas it is hard to pick a favorite. I was a stay at home mom & took my children there every week because there was always something new going on. I loved that as a small West Texas town we had so many people trying to bring a little bit of culture into our area.

data.title: Go for the statue alone
data.text: There's a statue of a specific incarnation of Santa Claus out front that is priceless. I didn't tour the museum, but I love that statue. Abilene has great statuary throughout.

data.title: Abilene does a very good job of museums.
data.text: Interactive and visually stimulating.  Really good way to spend a family afternoon.

data.title: Nice escape from summer heat
data.text: good nice learning environment with hands on kid related activities.  Nice place to kick back and get out of the heat while the kids can play and learn in a nice atmosphere

data.title: Fun with small children for the afternoon
data.text: The museum is nothing large, and it doesn't compare to other children's museums like the one in San Antonio, but for a smaller city, this one is fun for the afternoon. My son is two, and he really seemed to enjoy himself. There is an ambulance with lights and a dummy in the back for children to practice doctoring. There is a stage with costumes and some props for spontaneous plays. He enjoyed playing with the life size "Operation" game. He also enjoyed the gated area specifically designated for small toddlers and babies. The soft foam climb-on blocks were great for his size, and he enjoyed playing peekaboo in a tree house. We spent about an hour and half here. There isn't a lot to do, but for a very young child, it was fun.

data.title: Very Small, but some interesting stuff.
data.text: This is a half of floor in the Grace Cultural Museum.  There is neat things to see, but it is very small.  We are from Austin, where our children's museum is two stories and could take a better half of a day to explore.  This may entertain a child for an hour or two.

data.title: Excelente
data.text: Se está viajando com a familia, vá a esse museu, as crianças se divertem do inicio ao fim, são diversas atrações que deixam a garotada vidrada.
